alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued November 02 at 4:47AM EDT until November 02 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 degrees expected. * WHERE...The Piedmont and Southern Foothills of North Carolina and all of the Upstate of South Carolina and Northeast Georgia. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the Warned area has already dropped below 32 degrees this morning, ending the growing season. A determination will be made later this morning as to which forecast zones fell below freezing, therefore ending the frost freeze program for the year. If any counties do not get below freezing this morning, another freeze warning might be issued for tonight.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
